document.heading: Comprehensive Annual Financial Report Scheduling and Notice Requirement Act of 2000

history.narrative: Law 13-253, the “Comprehensive Annual Financial Report Scheduling and Notice Requirement Act of 2000”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 13-581, which was referred to the Committee Finance and Revenue. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 8, 2000, and December 5, 2000, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on December 21, 2000, it was assigned Act No. 13-540 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 13-253 became effective on April 3, 2001.
